reviewText: Boy, having just watched this one I can honestly say it was top ten worst cards ever. It was maybe worse than ufc 9While the SHerk vs Dunham fight was solid, and the Serra Lytle fight was a watchable but rather boring and pointless stand up battle, the other fighters rarely got it on at this show.Save your money

Title: N/A

reviewText: UFC 119 was a strange event which had former UFC heavyweight champion frank Mir facing off against Pride legend Mirko Cro Cop in a fight that would see the winner climb the rankings and this fight should have been all about Cro Cop's dangerous striking against Mir's dangerous Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu what we got was far from that maybe it was Cro cop taking the fight on short notice as Mir was originally supposed to fight Antnio Rodrigo Nogueira, but he had to pull out through injury.In the co main event you have rising star Ryan Bader taking on big nog's brother Antnio Rogério Nogueira(small nog), this fight is far from spectacular, what really saves this event is former UFC Lightweight Champion Sean Sherk taking on rising star Evan Dunham. This fight is a back and forth war and still has people talking about it! we also get a stand up war between good friends Matt Serra and Chris Lytle. Also the undercard has a heavyweight war between Joey Beltran and The Ultimate Fighter contestant Matt Mitrione.UFC 119 is not an essential purchase as the two main events are a let down, as with all UFC DVD's now there is loads of extras such as the countdown show which is always worth watching especially if you have not seen the event, watch that first. All the fights from the Preliminary card are included as well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the worst ppv I have seen since... I can't think of a worse event.The main event... Dana almost fired the winner! That's how bad it is. Crocop and Mir hugged (not grappled) and talked and laughed the entire time! Not even a sparring session!

reviewText: People were pissed about this. The question is, what pissed them off so badly about UFC 119? Well, the Main Event featured what should've been a lot better than it played out. Striker against the grappler, Mirko Cro Cop taking on Frank Mir. So let's start with Frank Mir. First and foremost, coming into this fight, he was coming off of a KO loss to Shane Carwin at UFC 111. So what else is new? Other than Lesnar, EVERYBODY got knocked out by Shane Carwin. Before that, he leveled Cheick Kongo, then he choked him out. And he's TKO'd Big Nog, the first to ever finish such a fighter. His grappling and jiu-jitsu is practically unmatched, and you really don't want to take it to the ground with him. But he can strike too. That's Frank Mir. Then you have Cro Cop. If he ever had any big wins in the UFC, it might have been his submission of Pat Barry. His other wins are by devastating TKO, but against who? Eddie Sanchez, Mostapha Al-Turk, Anthony Perosh? Hmmm...others have KO'd them too. But Cro Cop was the MAN in Pride. How many people has he KO'd with his signature head kicks? More importantly, who's going to take this? Will the striker get the best of this, or will the grapper take this easily? Unfortunately, the answer is nearly pathetic.Ryan Bader won The Ultimate Fighter in Season 8, and he's been winning ever since. Has he been overly impressive? Sometimes you can say yes, but not always. At UFC 110, he had a nice KO over Keith Jardine, but the man does go to decisions. But he also knows how to win. He's taking on Lil Nog, Antonio Rogerio Nogueira. And a lot of people think that Jason Brilz won the last fight he fought before this. I thought Brilz won that fight? Will one of these guys finish this time, or will we have another bad decision to complain about again?At least one of the decisions really made this an altogether sour card. That, and the Main Event until...well, if you got that far! I'm going to go as far as to say the preliminaries were better than the Main Card fights! Were all the Main Card fights horrible and awful? Not at all. SO, in saying all of that, there were 11 fights total, and I'll list them all. Just a warning...Mark Hunt vs. Sean McCorkle: Hunt is nothing short of a Pride legend, with a losing record, but with split decision wins over Cro Cop and Wanderlei Silva. Despite that losing record, Hunt does bring knock out power to the table. He takes on an Indiana oaf that is known as "Big Sexy." One of them strikes rather quickly with a 1st round submission!T.J. Grant vs. Julio Paulino: If there's a man with a questionable record that I really like in the UFC, it has to be Grant. He's taken out big names like Ryo Chonan, and TKO'd Kevin Burns. Standing across from him is a man looking for his first UFC win, who's looking to swing. This is a decent battle that goes to a unanimous decision!Steve Lopez vs. Waylon Lowe: At UFC 103, the unfortunate happened to Lopez, dislocating his shoulder after throwing a punch at Jim Miller, ending the fight. So he gets another chance. Waylon Lowe is kind of like the Jake O'Brien of the Lightweights. This is really a fight that belonged on the prelims, and ended with a split decision!Thiago Tavares vs. Pat Audinwood: A man who calls himself "Awesome," takes on a man who could stand to get a win. This scrap ends with a 1st round submission!Matt Mitrione vs. Joey Beltran: Ok, being Mitrione, coming into this fight, you just might have something to prove. You have 2 fights in the UFC, yes. But those 2 fights and TKO's came against a sloppy striker in Marcus Jones, and against a seasoned street fighter in Kimbo Slice. He's taking on a man who knows how to go to war, and he's shown it! BIG respect to the winner in this fight. It was a unanimous decision, and a FIGHT OF THE NIGHT!C.B. Dollaway vs. Joe Doerksen: This didn't last nearly as long as I figured it would. One man simply got caught, and eventually had to tap in the 1st! I've never seen this guy tap until this fight!Melvin Guillard vs. Jeremy Stephens: Ok, this should be a slugfest for the fans to talk about for years, right? NOPE. It goes all 3 rounds, with a few power shots landing here and there, and the winner gets the split decision!Sean Sherk vs. Evan Dunham: This fight pissed people off, and for good reason! I think we all know that the wrong man won this fight. But the only good thing about it was that it was the 2nd FIGHT OF THE NIGHT awarded at UFC 119. (more on that later in Main Event) This was a split decision as well!Matt Serra vs. Chris Lytle: The first time these 2 met, it was to win TUF 4, and to fight for the title. Both of them fought a rather safe fight for an extremely close split decision that could've gone either way. This time, they both come out and bring it, and one of them earns a well-deserved unanimous decision!Antonio Rogerio Nogueira vs. Ryan Bader: The question, was this impressive? I'm going to say yes and no. Nogueira didn't eek out a split decision that he didn't earn this time, but Bader did just enough to take this. Phil Davis fought a better fight than Bader did in this fight. Could've been a little better, but a unanimous decision!Frank Mir vs. Mirko Cro Cop: What a piss poor fight! Joe Rogan said about a minute before the end that he'd be getting chips if he were at home. Mir's response? "Ah, c'mon guys, I just finished a guy with no jiu-jitsu, what else do you want?" Hmm. How about a FIGHT next time, Mir? Yeah, he hit Mirko with a surprise knee that put him out 58 seconds before the fight was over. But is that supposed to be impressive if you don't make it a fight for the rest of the fight? Roy Nelson isn't going to be so light-hearted when you fight him, Frank! Get ready to actually FIGHT with Big Country!So, there you go. Do you want to watch this? You'll get some good fights, don't get me wrong. But are you going to feel ripped off by buying the DVD? I'm still not sure about that one.
summary: Lackluster Main Event And Poor Judging, Preliminaries Prevail!
Title: N/A
